entry.title: Supermarine Stranraer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Supermarine Stranraer (example pictured) had the nickname "whistling shithouse"?

entry.title: Lichfield Angel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 8th-century Lichfield Angel was discovered beneath the floor of Lichfield Cathedral in 2003?

entry.title: gun-powered mousetrap (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the gun-powered mousetrap never gained wide popularity after being patented in 1882, but was hailed as the "best mousetrap ever" in 2012?

entry.title: Tom Pashby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that ophthalmologist Tom Pashby spent 46 years improving the safety of hockey helmets?

entry.title: New York Yacht Club Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that women did not enter the upper stories of the New York Yacht Club Building for 35 years?

entry.title: Matthew Benham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that owner Matthew Benham influenced both Brentford FC in the UK and FC Midtjylland in Denmark to use mathematical modelling to recruit undervalued football players?

entry.title: Atkinson Hyperlegible (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to optimize Atkinson Hyperlegible for visually impaired people, its designers intentionally broke the rule that a typeface should be uniform?

entry.title: SooperDooperLooper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the name of the SooperDooperLooper was picked when a Hershey executive was outvoted by his wife and children?
